intro: Scandosorbus, commonly known as the rowan tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rosaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their opposite, simple leaves and showy, red or orange berries that contain seeds. Scandosorbus species are often found in woodland edges, mountainous areas, and rocky soils. They play an important role in ecosystems, providing food for birds and other wildlife.
